casebody.data:
Town of Beech Mountain
v.
Genesis Wildlife Sanctuary, Inc. No. 230A16 Supreme Court of North Carolina. July 7, 2016 Patrick H. Flanagan, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Meagan I. Kiser, Attorney at Law, Stacy C. Eggers, IV, Attorney at Law, Boone, Jaye E. Bingham-Hinch, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Town of Beech Mountain Charles E. Clement, Attorney at Law, Boone, John J. Korzen, Attorney at Law, for Genesis Wildlife Sanctuary, Inc. Charles A. Brady, III, Attorney at Law, Boone.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 5th of July 2016 by Plaintiff in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Dismissed by order of the Court in conference, this the 7th of July 2016."

Upon consideration of the petition in the Alternative filed by Plaintiff on the 5th of July 2016 in this matter for a writ of certiorari to review the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 7th of July 2016."

Therefore the case is docketed as of the date of this order's certification. Briefs of the respective parties shall be submitted to this Court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 15(g)(2).
